Title: Super Bowl 2025: How to Watch the Kendrick Lamar and SZA Halftime Show
Paragraphs: ["Kendrick Lamar and SZA will take the stage at the year's biggest football game -- but there's some controversy.", 'SZA and Kendrick Lamar, shown at the 2018 Coachella, will perform together during the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show.', "Some people watch the Super Bowl for the football, some for the commercials and some for the star-studded musical halftime show, which has come a long way since its wholesome Up With People days. It always features a superstar performer now, and it's the closest thing we have to a national concert. ", "Here's what to know and how to tune in to the Super Bowl 2025 halftime show.", "Influential musician and rapper and 17-time Grammy winner Kendrick Lamar (who's the recipient of the 2018 Pulitzer Prize for Music) is the halftime show headliner. And just the weekend before the Super Bowl, Lamar collected five Grammy Awards, all for his Drake diss track Not Like Us. He won record of the year, song of the year, best music video, best rap song and best rap performance.", "Like the Chiefs and the Eagles matchup, he's been here before. Lamar performed at the 2022 Super Bowl as part of a mega-show that also featured Dr. Dre, Eminem, Snoop Dogg and Mary J. Blige. That performance won a Primetime Emmy Award for outstanding variety special. But this year, he's taking center stage. ", "Performing at the Super Bowl with Lamar is his fellow Grammy winner SZA, who appeared on Lamar's recent album, GNX. Lamar and SZA also performed the Oscar-nominated All the Stars, the lead single from the 2018 hit movie Black Panther.", 'Lamar reportedly plans to perform his 2024 song Not Like Us during the halftime show. That\'s the diss track that just scooped up five Grammys, and it\'s famously aimed at his musical rival, Drake. Drake is suing record label Universal Music Group for defamation and harassment, alleging that the company helped to spread a "false and malicious" narrative about him via the song.', 'It\'s not just some simple insults, either. Drake\'s lawsuit alleges that UMG "approved, published and launched a campaign to create a viral hit out of a rap track that falsely accuses Drake of being a pedophile and calls for violent retribution against him."', 'The game is in Louisiana, and all the pre-game singers are from that state. Jon Batiste will sing the national anthem, Trombone Shorty and Lauren Daigle will sing America the Beautiful and Ledisi will perform Lift Every Voice and Sing before the game.', 'The Super Bowl will be played on Sunday, Feb. 9, at 6:30 p.m. ET (3:30 p.m. PT), in New Orleans.', "The big game will be broadcast nationally on Fox. This year, for the first time, you'll be able to watch the game on streaming service Tubi -- for free and in 4K. ", 'Read more: Super Bowl 2025: Date, Time, How to Watch Chiefs vs. Eagles for Free from Anywhere', 'The Kansas City Chiefs, led by quarterback Patrick Mahomes, are gunning for their third straight Super Bowl title. No team has ever won three in a row, and some fans are hoping for the first-ever three-peat.', "But the Chiefs will have to defeat the Philadelphia Eagles, who are looking for their second Super Bowl title ever. The Chiefs beat the Eagles two years ago for the first of their back-to-back titles. The Eagles beat Tom Brady's New England Patriots when they won the 2018 Super Bowl in Minneapolis. Brady has since retired from football and will be in the broadcast booth, calling the game for Fox."]

Title: 22 Wild Predictions For Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime Show That Will Have Drake Sweating
Paragraphs: ['', "A few bold predictions, but it's not enough.", 'BuzzFeed Contributor', 'At the Pepsi Super Bowl LVI Halftime Show (Dr. Dre headlining), Kendrick performed both "m.A.A.d. city" and "Alright." Despite those being two of his biggest songs, he might want to devote more time to songs that haven\'t had the grand stage yet.', 'It\'s hard to imagine him not incorporating the intro to "m.A.A.d city," but other intros can still get the crowd hyped.', 'The "Not Like Us" music video used the "Squabble Up" intro, so it makes sense to "wake up and look for the broccoli" out of the gate. I\'d say the intro, chorus, and the song\'s back end would be about one minute.', '"Why do you rap if it\'s fictional?" and "Let the wolves out. I\'ve been a dog." They feel like they need to be rapped on the big stage.', 'It may be the least bold prediction on this list, but I\'m sure the NFL would have loved Swift as a surprise guest. With Travis Kelce\'s Kansas City Chiefs in the Super Bowl, you can still expect her in the stadium, just not singing "Bad Blood."', "But that doesn't mean Lamar can't rap his part of the song. It's a 25-second rap verse that could segue nicely between songs. (Plus, many Swiftie eyes will be on the halftime show, which seems like a fun shout-out.)", 'It SHOULD be "Not Like Us," but as a sports fan, the song "DNA" has always been used for promotional reasons in different leagues. It\'s a big-time hype song; lyrically, it could be the best "clean" version of any of his songs.', 'One of my favorite Lamar memes is when he discusses his "wackest" song on BigBoyTV, and when he listens to his old music, it\'s hilarious. It\'d be a hilarious callback, but odds are, no time will be dedicated to this masterpiece.', 'I\'m sure he will not be the first to remix or sample "Oh When The Saints Go Marching In," but it\'d be an incredible homage to Louis Armstrong (born in New Orleans).', 'Bring out those trumpets!', 'Visually speaking, I bet whatever is planned for "Humble" will be intense. Looking at past performances, Lamar does not shy away from visually striking set designs.', 'His setlist has become so vast that he could skip "Humble" entirely, but it feels too mainstream to pass up.', "My boldest prediction is the number of songs on the setlist. With guest spots included, we may hear up to 13 different songs. That's the advantage of being a rapper. He can breeze through the songs and still leave the beats in as a transition into the next.", "We saw it done in Dre's hip-hop lineup for the Super Bowl LVI, who performed 11 songs. And each of them needed intros for individual performers. Lamar can power through his setlist and beat those numbers.", "Expect a million Easter eggs about Lamar's city of Compton. Road signs, architecture props, you name it. The man is proud of where he comes from and will share his culture with New Orleans.", 'Lamar has emphasized the game of football in teasers for his big show. New Orleans has three HBCUs, so why not give one (or all) a call to perform at the big game?', 'Imagine a cold opening of "Not Like Us" or "Humble" via a marching band.', '"TV Off" is one of Lamar\'s most popular songs on his latest album, GNX. This creates a strange problem: The NFL isn\'t going to love the idea of Kenny repeatedly yelling at people to "turn his TV off, turn his TV off."', "I don't know how, but I feel like this song might be on the chopping block for those lyrics unless there's a workaround: staying away from the chorus.", 'If we DO get "TV Off" on the setlist, DJ Mustard better be there to take in the crowd screaming \'MUSTARDDDDDDD!\'', 'Lamar has some slower jams, excluding any SZA hits, but "Euphoria" might be the closest thing we get to that for the big game.', "I don't know how heavy he will lean into the diss tracks, but he mentions field goals in it. Football game? Field goal? No?", 'With the combo of "Humble" and "DNA," the album DAMN will use up most of the time for the Super Bowl halftime show. This would be bold since so many popular tracks on GNX could be featured on the setlist, but I think they\'ll be done in snippets versus these two songs.', 'It SHOULD be one of the songs, but I have a weird feeling the time crunch and popularity of more mainstream songs will bump this out of the show entirely.', 'Despite having six collaborations with Lamar, the man will need a breather. To give time for a set/costume change, I could see SZA performing a portion of "Kill Bill" or a big hit.', 'Alternative R&B will be a nice change of pace, too.', 'With all the animosity between Lamar and Drake, Lil Wayne is still the most prominent New Orleans name that could appear. Although Wayne might be salty (and has every right to be) about not being the headliner, the Super Bowl was never about the biggest "local" name. It should always be the biggest name in the game that year...and it was Lamar\'s year.', "An appearance by Wayne could help put money in his own pocket, so why not swallow your pride and have some fun in front of your hometown? Maybe he won't rap, but my bold prediction is that he'll have some kind of presence.", 'I know people joke about him playing "Not Like Us" for 13 minutes straight, but this moment is for Lamar as an artist. He is now a 22-time Grammy Award winner, so he has given a lot to the music industry that goes beyond a diss track feud.', 'Many Vegas odds have this as the first song, but I think it\'s better to save it and make people believe he was asked not to play it. Even doing a fake ending to the show would be legendary, and then speaking the "I see dead people line" to revive the show.', 'It will be fascinating to see what is kept within the song lyrically.', 'At "The Pop Out: Ken & Friends" concert, Dr. Dre delivered the opening line to "Not Like Us." If it\'s not broken, don\'t fix it. This will be the perfect way to introduce the song to the masses.', 'But who will do it? Lil Wayne? Taylor Swift? DJ Mustard? Barack Obama? A significant name would be the perfect way to introduce the "Song of the Year."', 'As we saw at the Grammys, people adore this song. What better way to throw a Super Bowl bash than inviting all the friends out to the party? Who? I don\'t know, but I bet we will see something similar to "The Pop Out: Ken & Friends" concert for Juneteenth in 2024.', "Or perhaps it's just his closest friends from Compton. Either way, expect a party onstage.", "Because who wouldn't?", '']

Title: What time is the Super Bowl halftime show? When Kendrick Lamar will perform
Paragraphs: ["Kendrick Lamar has been granted the honor of playing the Super Bowl 59 halftime show. Title: Who is the Super Bowl halftime show 2025? Your guide to Grammy winner Kendrick Lamar
Paragraphs: ['Since the first Super Bowl in 1967, the halftime show has always been an attraction for fans during the longest scheduled break in the big game. That first title game featured marching bands from the University of Arizona and Grambling College.', 'The halftime show remained a showcase of marching bands through the 1980s into the 1990s. But things changed when Michael Jackson performed at the 1993 Super Bowl.', 'EVERY SUPER BOWL HALFTIME SHOW:Usher was the latest to headline a star-studded list', "The pop star's performance ushered in a new era of halftime shows. Since then, popular artists have been a mainstay for the Super Bowl. Title: Who's performing at the Super Bowl halftime show?
Paragraphs: ['Estimated read time: 3-4 minutes', "NEW ORLEANS ‚Äî The Super Bowl halftime show has always been a major part of the annual NFL event, and is America's most-watched musical performance of the year.", "Here is a look at Sunday's halftime show during the match between Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs in New Orleans.", '', '', "The halftime show will be performed by Kendrick Lamar, who has won 22 Grammy Awards throughout his career, including five this year for his song 'Not Like Us', which bagged the prestigious 'Song of the Year' and 'Record of the Year' awards on Sunday.", 'Lamar is the first solo rapper to headline the halftime show.', 'The 37-year-old also performed at Super Bowl 2022, alongside Dr Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem and Mary J. Blige. It was the first halftime show to be centered entirely around hip-hop music.', 'Lamar, who started out freestyling and battle rapping at school, released his debut studio album "Section.80" in 2011. The album sold 130,000 copies in the U.S. over the next three years.', 'Lamar has released five more studio albums, along with other records, selling over 17.9 million album-equivalent units worldwide. He has achieved five number-one singles in the U.S.', 'Singer-songwriter SZA will join Lamar as a special guest in the performance, which will be directed by Hamish Hamilton, who has directed the halftime show since 2010.', '', '', "Apple Music, the music, audio and video streaming service of Apple Inc. is the sponsor of this year's halftime performance.", 'The company took over sponsorship in 2023, when Rihanna performed, replacing Pepsi who had been sponsor since 2013.', '', '', 'The Super Bowl is scheduled to kick off at 6:30 p.m. ET, on Sunday, Feb. 9, with the halftime show expected to begin between 8 p.m. and 8:30 p.m.', 'The event will be broadcast live on FOX, FOX Deportes and streamed on Tubi.', '', '', 'In the beginning, the show mainly featured college marching bands, before progressing to drill teams and performance ensembles, but it all changed in 1991 when boy band New Kids on the Block were the headline act.', 'The rest of the Nineties had artists such as Michael Jackson, Diana Ross, Stevie Wonder and Gloria Estefan perform.', 'At the turn of the century, a number of different acts performed together. In 2000 Phil Collins, Christina Aguilera, Enrique Iglesias and Toni Braxton appeared and the following year brought Aerosmith and NSYNC together.', 'U2 replaced Janet Jackson in 2002, and the band performed a tribute to the victims of the 9/11 attacks. Jackson would get her chance in 2004, where her performance created controversy due to an infamous "wardrobe malfunction".', 'Justin Timberlake joined Jackson onstage, and at the end of the song "Rock Your Body" he tore off part of her top, briefly revealing her breast.', 'The incident led to a change for the next few years, with just one artist or group performing, mainly mainstream rock acts such as Paul McCartney, the Rolling Stones, Prince and Bruce Springsteen.', 'In 2011, contemporary artists made a return, with the previous format of a headline act and a number of guests.', 'Since then, Madonna, Beyonce, Bruno Mars, Katy Perry, Lady Gaga, Dr. Dre and Eminem have all performed at the show which guarantees them massive exposure, and a significant increase in album sales and digital downloads.', 'Show All 2 Photos', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

Title: Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl halftime performance fee is exposed
Paragraphs: ['Kendrick Lamar is lined up for an epic show at the 2025 Super Bowl.', "The iconic rapper will be the main act for the NFL championship halftime show, and he'll be joined by R&B star SZA, who he's worked with before. Despite what many people might think, Lamar won't be getting paid a big sum for his performance - in fact, he won't get any money at all.", 'However, this is nothing new, as Super Bowl halftime performers don\'t typically get paid. The NFL covers all the costs for the show, including travel expenses, instead. As an NFL representative explained to The Independent, the league "covers all costs associated with the show and does pay the halftime performers\' union scale" for Lamar\'s team.', "The idea is that the huge exposure from the performance, which is seen by over 100 million people worldwide, acts as a huge promotion for the artist's music and other projects.", 'After her fantastic 2023 Super Bowl halftime show, Rihanna saw a huge boost in music and Fenty Beauty brand sales.', "Right after the live show, the Umbrella singer's songs jumped 640 percent on Spotify. Launchmetrics' brand performance insight tool says that in the first 12 hours after the show, the Barbadian star made a media impact value of $88.3 million.", 'Lady Gaga, reflecting on her own experience, saw a whopping 1000 percent increase in her album and song sales following her electrifying 2017 performance. In the same vein, Jennifer Lopez gained a staggering 2.3 million new Instagram followers after her 2020 performance alongside Shakira.', "It's important to note the hefty amounts spent on these halftime spectacles; the NFL and Apple Music typically contribute around $10 million to cover production staff, as well as the extravagant sets and top-notch audio equipment. Interestingly, The Weeknd in 2021 and Dr. Dre previously dug deep into their own pockets, spending $7 million each to enhance their shows.", 'The upcoming Super Bowl LIX, set to take place in New Orleans on February 9 at 6:30 p.m., will see a thrilling clash between the current giants, the Kansas City Chiefs, and the Philadelphia Eagles. Recalling their last face-off in 2023, it was the Chiefs who triumphed with a nail-biting 38-35 win.', "Kendrick scored a significant victory at the 67th Annual Grammy Awards on Sunday night, beating out Beyonce and the Beatles among other music stars for Record of The Year with his explosive hip-hop anthem Not Like Us. Kendrick's win for his scathing track about Drake seems to further solidify who the victor of their rap feud truly is.", "Many supported Kendrick's win on X, formerly Twitter, viewing it as evidence of who emerged victorious in the fierce diss track battle between the two rap superstars that took place last year.", 'DAILY NEWSLETTER: Sign up here to get the latest news and updates from the Mirror US straight to your inbox with our FREE newsletter.', '']

Title: Fresh off Grammy wins, Kendrick Lamar poised for ‚Äòspecial‚Äô Super Bowl halftime show
Paragraphs: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'After the biggest year of his professional career ‚Äî which resulted in five Grammy Awards for his iconic Drake diss ‚ÄúNot Like Us‚Äù ‚Äî rapper Kendrick Lamar will take the biggest stage in America when he performs at the Super Bowl on Sunday.', 'Lamar‚Äôs performance, which will also include singer SZA, is highly anticipated after he dominated both culture and music charts for much of 2024. And the people who helped put him onstage aren‚Äôt shying away from the hype.', '‚ÄúEveryone will agree this is a halftime show like none other in Super Bowl halftime history,‚Äù Jesse Collins, the executive producer of the show, told NBC News. ‚ÄúThe creative concept is really something brilliant, spectacular and special. In all of our years of doing this ‚Äî and I think every show that we‚Äôve done has been amazing ‚Äî but I have never seen an artist take this creative approach to it.‚Äù', 'Roc Nation, the entertainment company and NFL partner that produces the halftime show, first tabbed Lamar to headline the Super Bowl last summer. He was already a critically acclaimed rapper, and his stardom reached another level after the May 4 release of ‚ÄúNot Like Us,‚Äù the knockout blow in his feud with Drake, the Canadian rapper.', "The song broke multiple streaming records and earned Lamar five Grammy awards, making it the most decorated rap song in the award show's history.", 'Not long after the song was released, Lamar got a phone call from Roc Nation founder Jay-Z asking him whether he would perform at the Super Bowl.', '‚ÄúIt‚Äôs almost like the stars aligning,‚Äù Roc Nation CEO Desiree Perez told NBC News. ‚ÄúWe would hope that every single year someone accomplishes what Kendrick has accomplished this particular year. You can‚Äôt even really plan for something to align so perfectly.‚Äù', 'Lamar‚Äôs halftime performance will also be the first since the NFL and Roc Nation extended their partnership ‚Äî which encompasses both live music and social justice efforts ‚Äî in October. Roc Nation‚Äôs halftime shows have been well-received, with the 2022 show featuring Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem and Mary J. Blige becoming the first Super Bowl halftime to win an Emmy.', 'Perez said the NFL has been very trusting as a partner, never once questioning a decision about the artist selection.', '‚ÄúWhat we bring to the table is not just booking the show; it‚Äôs also understanding the environment that we‚Äôre going into and understanding what‚Äôs going on now,‚Äù Perez says. ‚ÄúUnderstanding the pulse of culture at the moment when the show is going to happen and doing that with precision is what I think we‚Äôve been able to master.‚Äù', 'Planning for a Super Bowl halftime typically begins immediately after the previous one, which means Roc Nation has been in meetings for Sunday‚Äôs show since last February. During the week of the game, preparation will reach a fever pitch.', 'Lamar will have at least three days on the field to rehearse before Sunday, and on those days the performers will run through the entire set multiple times. The halftime show is unique in terms of timing and staging ‚Äî Lamar has exactly eight minutes to get on the field and six minutes to get off, without damaging the surface where the game is supposed to take place. (Simply getting the stage on and off the field takes more than 100 people, Collins said.)', 'As for what to expect during the show itself, everyone is predictably tight-lipped. Perez said that whether or not other artists will be involved is entirely up to Lamar, though she said there will be ‚Äúa few surprises that we haven‚Äôt seen in the past.‚Äù', '‚ÄúKendrick is one of the most creative, incredible artists of our lifetime, and ... he is not going to disappoint,‚Äù she said when she was asked directly what fans should be excited for.', 'Collins said: ‚ÄúRoc Nation, Jay, Kendrick and his whole team, we‚Äôve all really busted our ass to figure out something different. And I think people are going to be blown away.‚Äù', 'Rohan Nadkarni is a sports reporter for NBC News. ', '¬© 2025 NBCUniversal Media, LLC', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

Title: Kendrick Lamar takes another subtle dig at Drake in feud with Canadian tuxedo at Grammys
Paragraphs: ['The Grammy Awards delivered a (gold-plated) nail in the coffin of the long-running feud between rappers Kendrick Lamar and Drake.', 'After trading diss tracks (and a lawsuit) Lamar snagged best song and record of the year Grammys for his critically acclaimed Drake diss, "Not Like Us."', "If subtlety cuts like a knife, Lamar came with his blade sharpened Sunday, sporting denim-on-denim for his win. The combination, often called a Canadian tuxedo, seemed to be another dig at Drake, who is Canadian. Lamar's recent choice to collaborate with Drake's ex SZA, for his Super Bowl halftime show headlining performance and on both of their recent albums adds fuel to the fire.", 'Lamar won five Grammys on Sunday, also taking home awards for best music video, best rap performance and best rap song for the diss track.', 'Need a break? Play the USA TODAY Daily Crossword Puzzle.', "How many Grammys did Kendrick Lamar win?Here's how the rapper fared at 2025 awards show", "We're extremely online so you don't have to be: Sign up for USA TODAY's Everyone's Talking newsletter for all the internet buzz.", "Drake was not at Sunday night's Grammys. Drake has skipped the award show and declined to submit to the Grammys over the last few years, so he didn't receive any nominations.", 'The Canadian emcee has criticized the Recording Academy for its "disconnect," including shutting The Weeknd out of nominations at the 2021 ceremony. He later withdrew his studio album "Certified Lover Boy" from being considered for the 2022 Grammys.', 'Laced with double entendres, "Not Like Us" track accuses Drake and his associates of being predators, employing a play on one of the Canadian rapper\'s album titles with the lyrics, "Certified Lover Boy? Certified pedophile."', 'The cover art of "Not Like Us" showed a photo of Drake\'s house covered in red markers that are used to identify registered sex offenders. The "Not Like Us" music video opens with Lamar doing push-ups on cinderblocks in response to Drake\'s own diss track "Push Ups." He later uses owl symbolism in reference to the mascot for Drake\'s record label OVO Sound and makes it clear they\'re enemies. In one shot, Lamar smashes an owl pinÃÉata.', "What does '6:16 in LA' mean?Fans analyze Kendrick Lamar's latest Drake diss", 'That Lamar took home not one, but two of the Grammy\'s most coveted awards may rub salt in the wound for Drake, who is currently suing both Spotify and Universal Music Group ‚àí which represents both him and Lamar ‚àí for allegedly inflating the streaming data for "Not Like Us."', 'A rap diss record getting a Grammy nomination (and win) isn\'t unprecedented. Drake\'s own Meek Mill diss record "Back to Back" was nominated for best rap performance at the 2016 Grammys. (You\'ll never guess who he lost to: Lamar, for his "To Pimp a Butterfly" single and modern-day protest anthem "Alright.")', 'LL Cool J\'s "Mama Said Knock You Out" was the first diss track to win a Grammy, taking home the award for best rap performance in 1991. The song is partly directed at rapper Kool Moe Dee, with whom LL Cool J had a long-standing feud.', "A beef the magnitude of Drake vs. Kendrick has not shaken the rap world in some time, however. The roots of Lamar and Drake's feud go back more than a decade to 2013, though things quickly intensified this past spring as the two traded bars and barbs with shocking allegations.", 'Before "Not Like Us" and following a surprise drop of his brutal Drake diss track "Euphoria," the Compton, California, native released "6:16 in LA." The song title is an obvious reference to a timestamp song format Drake has popularized, including "6PM in New York" and "8am in Charlotte."', 'But fans also believed the "6:16" diss had multiple other meanings: June 16 is Father\'s Day in the U.S. and Canada; June 16 is also the birthday of late rapper Tupac Shakur, who Drake invoked using AI amid the feud; the first episode of TV drama "Euphoria," which is executive produced by Drake, debuted on HBO on June 16, 2019; and June 16 was the apparent date of a Kendrick Lamar concert in Toronto, among a few other possible meanings.', 'Lamar also hit the stage over the summer on Juneteenth for "The Pop Out ‚Äì Ken & Friends" concert at the Kia Forum, performing "Not Like Us" five times, telling the crowd between the encore performances: "Y\'all ain\'t gonna let anyone disrespect the West Coast, huh?" ', 'Lamar\'s halftime performance is expected to draw from his latest album "GNX," which does not feature "Not Like Us"; however, given the track\'s popularity, Drake\'s nightmare may be far from over. The diss track may end up on music ‚àí and sport\'s ‚àí biggest stage.', 'Contributing: Brendan Morrow, Taijuan Moorman, KiMi Robinson, Anika Reed, Jay Stahl']

Title: Super Bowl halftime show's history in New Orleans shows how it has evolved
Paragraphs: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'The halftime show for Super Bowl IV, the first held in New Orleans, featured a smorgasbord of New Orleans culture, including music by the Onward and Olympia brass bands. Performers are, from left: Danny Barker, with cigar; Louis Nelson, trombone; Jack Willis, trumpet; Wendell Eugene, trombone; Alvin Alcorn, trumpet; and Louis Cottrell Jr., clarinet. The Kansas City Chiefs beat the Detroit Lions, 19-17 at Tulane Stadium; the game was blacked out in New Orleans.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'The Super Bowl halftime show has grown ‚Äúincreasingly vile.‚Äù', 'So say 17 Louisiana legislators who recently signed a letter urging the Greater New Orleans Sports Foundation and the Louisiana Stadium and Expo District to help make Sunday‚Äôs Super Bowl LIX halftime show ‚Äúas family friendly as possible.‚Äù', '‚ÄúFamily friendly‚Äù is, of course, a highly subjective standard. What seems overly sexual or crass to some is just fine to others.', 'Popular culture and society at large have grown increasingly coarse since the first Super Bowl nearly six decades ago.', 'SZA will join Kendrick Lamar during the Super Bowl LIX halftime show.', 'And the Super Bowl halftime show, in its current iteration, ultimately aims to reflect popular culture.', 'Rapper Kendrick Lamar will star in what is officially the Apple Music Super Bowl Halftime Show in the Caesars Superdome on Sunday. He‚Äôll be joined by the singer SZA, a frequent collaborator.', 'Whether their performance qualifies as ‚Äúfamily friendly‚Äù will be debated.', 'But if the Super Bowl‚Äôs history in New Orleans is any indication, the halftime show is unlikely to return to the more conservative standards of yore any time soon.', 'Now a meticulously planned and relentlessly promoted multi-million-dollar segment of the Super Bowl broadcast, halftime was once an afterthought.', 'In January 1967, the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum hosted the first Super Bowl. The eclectic halftime show included New Orleans trumpet titan Al Hirt, the Grambling State and University of Arizona marching bands, two men soaring above the field on Bell Aerosystems jet packs and the release of hundreds of pigeons.', 'New Orleans hosted its first Super Bowl in January 1970 at Tulane Stadium. Halftime show producer Tommy Walker orchestrated a 20-minute showcase of New Orleans musical and cultural greatest hits.', 'A touch of Mardi Gras, in the form of a parade including inflatable figures, was added to the halftime entertainment of Super Bowl IV at Tulane Stadium in New Orleans on Jan. 11, 1970.', 'He had spent 11 years as the director of entertainment at Disneyland, where he oversaw ‚ÄúDixieland at Disneyland,‚Äù an annual concert series that, in 1961, featured Louis Armstrong.', 'After leaving Disneyland, Walker organized halftime shows and pre-game entertainment for the New Orleans Saints‚Äô inaugural 1967 season. He also produced 1968‚Äôs International Jazz Festival at the Municipal Auditorium, a precursor to the New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival.', '', 'At the outset of Super Bowl IV‚Äôs ‚ÄúWay Down Yonder‚Äù halftime show, announcer Jack Whittaker urged the Tulane Stadium crowd to give a ‚Äúresounding welcome to that fast-stepping, toe-tapping band from Jaguar-land, the Southern University Band.‚Äù', 'After Southern‚Äôs opening, Whittaker introduced ‚Äúking‚Äù Al Hirt, ‚Äúhis scepter a golden horn.‚Äù Hirt riffed over the Southern band before New Orleans-born opera singer Marguerite Piazza joined them for ‚ÄúBasin Street Blues.‚Äù', 'The Southern band remained on the field during a recreation of the Battle of New Orleans. Dozens of reenactors in period costumes fired blanks from cannons and muskets; some ‚Äúdied‚Äù dramatically as smoke obscured the field.', 'There was more. A riverboat manned by young women in hoop skirts ‚Äúsailed‚Äù onto the field. Hirt and jazz vibraphonist Lionel Hampton performed ‚ÄúDo You Know What It Means to Miss New Orleans.‚Äù', 'Halftime festivities at Super Bowl IV at Tulane Stadium included a Battle of New Orleans re-enactment, a Mardi Gras parade and a performance by trumpeter Al Hirt, among other acts. The game, played on Jan. 11, 1970, at Tulane Stadium, saw the Kansas City Chiefs defeat the Minnesota Vikings 23-7 in the first Super Bowl played in New Orleans.', 'The Olympia and Onward brass bands, trailed by dozens of social aid and pleasure club dancers, led an abridged jazz funeral second-line.', 'Halftime culminated with a mini-Mardi Gras parade as Hampton flailed away on drums and Hirt and fellow trumpeter Doc Severinson, leader of ‚ÄúThe Tonight Show‚Äù band, pushed their horns to the limit.', 'Two years later, the Super Bowl returned to Tulane Stadium, as did Hirt. On January 16, 1972, he, Ella Fitzgerald and Carol Channing saluted New Orleans jazz icon Louis Armstrong, who had died six months earlier.', 'In January 1978, Super Bowl XII moved into the Superdome. A local connection was still a priority for halftime shows, as Hirt and New Orleans clarinet legend Pete Fountain presided over "From Paris to the Paris of America.‚Äù', 'In the 1980s, the Super Bowl halftime often featured Up With People, a quasi-religious troupe of relentlessly upbeat young people performing watered-down takes on popular songs.', 'Bono fronts U2 during halftime of Super Bowl XXXVI at the Louisiana Superdome on Feb. 3, 2002, in New Orleans. Drummer Larry Mullen is at right. (AP Photo/Amy Sancetta)', 'In 1990, Fountain returned as part of a combination ‚ÄúSalute to New Orleans‚Äù and commemoration of the 40th anniversary of the Peanuts cartoon ‚Äì the sort of arbitrary mash-up that often turned up in halftime shows. New Orleans rhythm & blues legend Irma Thomas and Cajun fiddler Doug Kershaw also took part.', 'In 1992, the upstart Fox network ‚Äî still years away from hosting its first NFL game ‚Äî counter-programmed a live episode of its popular ‚ÄúIn Living Color‚Äù during the Super Bowl‚Äôs widely panned ‚ÄúWinter Magic‚Äù halftime show. That some 22 million viewers abandoned the Super Bowl in favor of Fox got the NFL‚Äôs attention.', 'The halftime show needed to step up its game.', 'The next year‚Äôs featured entertainer? Michael Jackson, still a superstar largely untainted by scandal.', 'After Jackson, the NFL still wasn‚Äôt committed to the notion of a solitary halftime headliner. Actor and New Orleans resident John Goodman was onstage in the Superdome during Super Bowl XXXI in 1997 for the ‚ÄúBlues Brothers Bash,‚Äù cavorting alongside Jim Belushi, Dan Aykroyd, James Brown and ZZ Top.', 'By the time the Super Bowl returned to the Superdome in 2002, spotlighting the host city was no longer a priority. For the first Super Bowl following the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001, U2 balanced acknowledging the tragedy and remembering the victims ‚Äì whose names scrolled on screens inside the Dome ‚Äì while also delivering an uplifting show.', 'Following the Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake ‚Äúnipple-gate‚Äù scandal triggered by 2003‚Äôs ‚Äúwardrobe malfunction‚Äù ‚Äì an incident cited in the Louisiana legislators‚Äô recent letter about the halftime show‚Äôs supposed lack of decency ‚Äì the NFL trusted only men with guitars for the next five Super Bowls.', "In this Feb. 4, 2007, file photo, Prince performs during the halftime show at the Super Bowl XLI football game in Miami. The saga to settle Prince's estate provides a cautionary tale about what can happen when someone dies without leaving a will, as he did when he died of an accidental opioid overdose at his Paisley Park studio April 21, 2016.", 'Paul McCartney, the Rolling Stones, Prince ‚Äì widely acknowledged as one of, if not the, greatest halftime performer ever ‚Äì Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers and Bruce Springsteen & the E Street Band all took a turn.', 'The Who performed in 2010 at the Super Bowl won by the Saints. By that point, The Who was 30 years past its commercial, creative and cultural peak.', 'The NFL subsequently fast-forwarded the entertainment by a couple decades to present contemporary pop acts: the Black Eyed Peas, Madonna and, for 2013‚Äôs Super Bowl XLVII in the Superdome, Beyonce.', 'More pop followed: Bruno Mars, Katy Perry, Coldplay, Lady Gaga, Justin Timberlake.', 'Pop-rock Maroon 5‚Äôs 2019 performance in Atlanta forced another reevaluation: where was hip-hop, by then a dominant force in popular music?', 'The league subsequently partnered with rap icon Jay-Z‚Äôs Roc Nation, a company that includes a record label and music and sports management divisions, to curate the halftime and pregame shows.', 'Beyonce performs during the Pepsi Super Bowl XLVII Halftime Show football game between the San Francisco 49ers and the Baltimore Ravens, in New Orleans in 2013.', 'Planning the halftime show, Roc Nation CEO Desiree Perez said in a recent interview, ‚Äúis about when, why, who. What is the theme? What is the pulse of the times, of where we‚Äôre going, of what people are listening to?‚Äù', 'Roc Nation put Shakira and Jennifer Lopez onstage in Miami ‚Äì another show that the Louisiana legislators complained about. The company has also presented the Weeknd, an all-star hip-hop revue with Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Kendrick Lamar, Eminem and Mary J. Blige, Rihanna and, last year, Usher.', 'This Sunday‚Äôs pre-game show boasts an all-Louisiana cast with Jon Batiste singing the national anthem, Troy ‚ÄúTrombone Shorty‚Äù Andrews and Lauren Daigle teaming up for ‚ÄúAmerica the Beautiful‚Äù and Ledisi lofting ‚ÄúLift Every Voice and Sing.‚Äù', 'Then it‚Äôs Kendrick Lamar‚Äôs turn at halftime.', 'His career is at an all-time high. Last weekend, his ‚ÄúNot Like Us‚Äù ‚Äì a ‚Äúdiss‚Äù track aimed at rival rapper Drake ‚Äì won both record and song of the year at the Grammy Awards. In April, he‚Äôll embark on the Grand National Tour, his first stadium-headlining tour, with SZA.', 'His star turn in the Superdome will be less about Louisiana and more about how the halftime show has evolved.', 'Email Keith Spera at kspera@theadvocate.com.', 'News Tips:\nnolanewstips@theadvocate.com', 'Other questions:\nsubscriberservices@theadvocate.com', 'Need help?', '', 'This website stores data such as cookies to enable essential website functionality, marketing, personalization and analytics. By remaining on this website you indicate your consent. See updated terms and conditions.']

Title: Who is Kendrick Lamar? Revisiting his beef with Drake ahead of the Super Bowl halftime show.
Paragraphs: ['Lamar, the 22-time Grammy-winning artist, will headline Sunday‚Äôs Super Bowl halftime show', 'The Super Bowl halftime show debuted in 1967, featuring marching bands from the University of Arizona and Grambling College (now, Grambling State University) performing The Sound of Music and When the Saints Go Marching In. Since then, the show has expanded into one of the biggest attractions ‚Äî featuring some of the most popular names in music.', 'The halftime show has featured artists such as Prince, Michael Jackson, Beyonc√©, Rihanna, and The Rolling Stones. It has also given fans some iconic moments such as Prince performing Purple Rain ‚Äî in the pouring rain ‚Äî Beyonc√© reuniting with Destiny‚Äôs Child, Rihanna‚Äôs baby bump, and Janet Jackson‚Äôs wardrobe malfunction.', 'This year‚Äôs halftime show will most likely give fans even more iconic moments. Rapper Kendrick Lamar will perform with special guest singer and songwriter SZA. Here‚Äôs everything you need to know about Lamar ahead of his Super Bowl LIX halftime performance.', 'This question has quite a few answers. Kendrick Lamar is also Kung Fu Kenny, K-Dot, Mr. Morale, and Pulitzer Kenny. Lamar goes by many aliases and G.O.A.T. may be his favorite one ‚Äî but for the sake of this story, we‚Äôll call him Lamar.', 'Lamar is a 22-time Grammy-winning hip-hop recording artist from Compton, Calif. He‚Äôs the only male rapper in history to win five Grammys in one night ‚Äî and he‚Äôs done that three times (2016, 2018, 2025). And he‚Äôs the only rapper to ever win a Pulitzer Prize for his 2017 album DAMN. Lamar has immensely impacted the hip-hop industry. He was named one of Time‚Äôs 100 most influential people in the world in 2016.', 'The rapper was previously signed with Top Dawg Entertainment and recorded five studio albums with Top Dawg, before founding his own record label, P.G. Lang, in 2020. His most recent album and the sixth studio album, GNX, was released through P.G. Lang and Interscope Records. The album features various West Coast recording artists and breathed new life into his long-existing beef with Canadian rapper Drake.', 'The easy answer to this question can be that the beef began with the release of the song Like That in 2024. This was a song by Future and Metro Boomin that featured a verse from Lamar where he delivered a sharp diss to both Drake and J. Cole in response to their song First Person Shooter ‚Äî claiming there‚Äôs a ‚Äúbig three‚Äù in hip-hop, Drake, Cole, and Lamar.', 'But this entire beef really started years ago when Lamar dropped his verse on Big Sean‚Äôs Control song in 2013. Lamar name-drops a number of rappers, including Drake, and Drake didn‚Äôt take this lightly. Since then, they‚Äôve thrown subliminal shots at one another through their music. Like That was the first time Lamar really called out Drake‚Äôs name again.', 'But there wasn‚Äôt always a beef between the two rappers. Lamar joined Drake on his ‚ÄúTake Care‚Äù tour in 2011 and the artists collaborated on Lamar‚Äôs song Poetic Justice in 2012. Another Drake and Lamar collab seems like a long shot now after the multiple diss tracks they‚Äôve dropped this past year.', 'After Like That was released, Drake responded with a diss track of his own, titled Push Ups. But it didn‚Äôt stop there; 11 days later, Lamar released another furious six-minute diss called Euphoria. Days later, he dropped another song called 6:16 in LA, which led to Drake releasing a song called Family Matters. But once again, it didn‚Äôt stop there ‚Äî Lamar dropped two more diss tracks on the same day, Meet the Grahams and Not Like Us.', 'Not Like Us has grown in popularity, racking up 96 million streams in one week and recently winning five Grammys ‚Äî including Song of the Year, Record of the Year, Best Rap Song, Best Music Video, and Best Rap Performance.', 'Fans can expect to hear the five-time Grammy-winning song during Sunday‚Äôs Super Bowl performance. How many times will Lamar perform it? That should be a prop bet of its own. The last time Lamar performed Not Like Us on stage was during his Pop Out concert in California on June 19. The rapper performed the song five times as everyone joined in dancing ‚Äî including NBA players Russell Westbrook and DeMar DeRozan, both from Los Angeles.', 'But if you miss Lamar‚Äôs performance on Sunday, you can catch him in concert during his stadium tour with SZA beginning in April.', 'Since the release of Not Like Us, Drake has filed a lawsuit for defamation and harassment against Universal Music Group ‚Äî which represents both artists. The lawsuit accuses UMG of defamation by publishing and spreading a ‚Äúfalse and malicious narrative.‚Äù', 'The lawsuit alleges that UMG ‚Äúapproved, published, and launched a campaign to create a viral hit out of a rap track that falsely accuses Drake of being a pedophile and calls for violent retribution against him.‚Äù Now, Drake is seeking nominal, punitive, and compensatory damages.']

Title: Super Bowl halftime show: Who is performing, when to watch and how to stream
Paragraphs: ['', '', 'This year‚Äôs match-up will see the Kansas City Chiefs once again take on the Philadelphia Eagles', '', '', "From reproductive rights to climate change to Big Tech, The Independent is on the ground when the story is developing. Whether it's investigating the financials of Elon Musk's pro-Trump PAC or producing our latest documentary, 'The A Word', which shines a light on the American women fighting for reproductive rights, we know how important it is to parse out the facts from the messaging.", '', '', 'Super Bowl 59 is fast approaching with the Kansas City Chiefs looking to defend their championship title for a third consecutive year ‚Äî this time against the Philadelphia Eagles.', 'The two teams previously faced off against each other in 2023, with the Chiefs winning 38-35. The following year, the Kansas City team once again clinched the Super Bowl game against the San Francisco 49ers 25-22.', 'Now, the Chiefs return to the field hoping for a three-peat against the Eagles at the 2025 Super Bowl taking place in New Orleans, Louisiana on Sunday, February 9, beginning at 6:30 p.m. EST.', 'While millions of sports fans are no doubt eager for the forthcoming game, there are still a number of people who are more interested in tuning in for the halftime show.', 'Read below to find out more about who‚Äôs performing and when and how to watch it.', 'Who is performing the halftime show?', 'This year‚Äôs halftime show will be headlined by Grammy-winning rapper Kendrick Lamar, who will be joined by his longtime collaborator, R&B star SZA.', 'Lamar, 37, was announced as the halftime performer in September by Jay-Z, whose company Roc Nation works with the NFL to select the halftime show performer.', '‚ÄúKendrick Lamar is truly a once-in-a-generation artist and performer,‚Äù Jay-Z said in a statement at the time. ‚ÄúHis deep love for hip-hop and culture informs his artistic vision. He has an unparalleled ability to define and influence culture globally. Kendrick‚Äôs work transcends music, and his impact will be felt for years to come.‚Äù', 'It‚Äôs not yet known if Lamar plans on bringing out any other guest performers.', 'When is the halftime show and how to watch it', 'Although football games are scheduled for 60 minutes, they typically last three and a half hours, due to injuries, penalties, and media timeouts. So, there is no set time for when the halftime show will take place. However, since it takes place midway through the game, it‚Äôs safe to assume Lamar will likely take the stage between 8 p.m. and 8:30 p.m. EST.', 'Fox is broadcasting the game this year, but for those who no longer have cable, Tubi will also be live-streaming it for free.', 'Are there any other artists performing at the 2025 Super Bowl?', 'Yes. It‚Äôs been announced that Grammy-winning singer and New Orleans native Jon Batiste will be performing the national anthem ahead of the game, while Lauren Daigle and Trombone Shorty will perform ‚ÄúAmerica the Beautiful.‚Äù', 'Join thought-provoking conversations, follow other Independent readers and see their replies', '']

['Kendrick Lamar is cementing his name in the history books.', 'The 37-year-old rapper took home five honors at the 2025 Grammys on Sunday. Overall, Lamar has been nominated 57 times for a Grammy and is one of the most celebrated rappers in Grammy history.', "Grammys 2025 recap: Best moments from music's biggest night", 'At the 67th Grammy Awards, Lamar won five Grammys, including best music video, best rap performance, best rap song, song of the year and record of the year, all for his hit "Not Like Us."', 'Grammys 2025: Winners list', 'Lamar\'s 2025 Grammy wins bring his total Grammy Award count to 22. He won his first two Grammys in 2015 for best rap song and best rap performance for "I."', 'Lamar has been writing lyrics and songs since he was a teenager in high school and released his first mixtape in 2003 under the stage name K.Dot. His sound mixes rap with jazz and funk elements and lyrical storytelling, such as with 2011\'s "Rigamortus" and 2015\'s "King Kunta."', 'The Compton, California, native has quickly catapulted to hip-hop stardom with albums like "Good Kid, M.A.A.D City," "To Pimp a Butterfly" and "DAMN," the last of which won the Pulitzer Prize in music in 2018, having been recognized for "its vernacular authenticity and rhythmic dynamism" that highlights "the complexity of modern African-American life."', 'His most recent album, "GNX," released in November 2024, features guests such as SZA, Dody6, and Lefty GunPlay. The surprise release includes the tracks "wacced out murals," which appears to call out music industry heavyweights and addresses Lil Wayne being snubbed for the Super Bowl halftime show, and "heart pt. 6," seemingly named after a diss track released by Drake.', "Kendrick Lamar and fellow rapper Drake's rap feud came to a head in the summer of 2024, with the two competing for fans, lyricism, and beats, and taking the feud to new levels with more diss tracks and more personal accusations.", 'In May 2024, Lamar released "6:16 in LA" and Drake followed with "Family Matters."', 'Lamar subsequently released "Meet the Grahams," followed by "Not Like Us" and "heart pt. 6."', '"heart pt. 6" features provocative lyrics including, "Say, Drake, I hear you like \'em young" and "You better not ever go to cell block one." Drake has since sued his music label Universal Music Group for defamation, claiming the label promoted label mate Lamar\'s song and alleged "UMG approved, published, and launched a campaign to create a viral hit out of a rap track which was intended to convey the specific, unmistakeable, and false factual allegation that Drake is a criminal pedophile."', 'The music label fired back in a response, saying Drake "intentionally and successfully used UMG to distribute his music and poetry to engage in conventionally outrageous, back-and-forth rap battles to express his feelings about other artists. He now seeks to weaponize the legal process to silence an artist\'s creative expression."', 'Lamar and his fiancee Whitney Alford have been linked for years, and the longtime couple share two children. Alford and their kids are even featured in the music video for "Not Like Us," with the family dancing together in a living room as Lamar raps, "The family matter and the truth of the matter. It was God\'s plan to show y\'all the liar."', 'Lamar is set to perform the Super Bowl halftime show Feb. 9 at the Caesars Superdome in New Orleans.', 'Lamar is expected to feature singer-songwriter SZA in the performance, with whom he collaborated on two songs -- "luther" and "gloria" -- for "GNX," his latest album.', '"Rap music is still the most impactful genre to date. And I\'ll be there to remind the world why. They got the right one," Lamar said in a September 2024 press release announcing the performance.', 'Seth Dudowsky, the head of music at the NFL, also praised Lamar\'s "unique ability to craft moments that resonate, redefine, and ultimately shake the very foundation of hip-hop."', '"We\'re excited to collaborate with Kendrick, Roc Nation, and Apple Music to deliver another unforgettable Halftime Show," said Dudowsky.', '']

Title: Who is Kendrick Lamar? Everything to know about Super Bowl 59's halftime performer
Paragraphs: ["His hard work may have let Lil Wayne down, but that doesn't mean he'll sit down and be humble.", "In just under a week, Kendrick Lamar will take the stage for one of his biggest career performances: the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show. He'll be the headliner for the show on Super Bowl Sunday, and R&B singer/songwriter SZA will join him as a special guest.", 'The Super Bowl will be something of a culmination of a massive year for Lamar, who made headlines last spring for his back-and-forth feud with fellow rapper Drake. He also just released his sixth studio album in late November and is preparing for an upcoming North America tour.', 'USA TODAY Sports has all of the info that curious NFL fans need to know about Lamar here, in one place.', 'KENDRICK LAMAR:Predicting the setlist for the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show', 'Expert Super Bowl picks: Unique betting insights only at USA TODAY.', 'Lamar is a native of Compton, California.', 'Lamar has never been the sole headliner at the Super Bowl halftime show before, though he has been on stage for a previous halftime show performance.', 'During the Super Bowl 56 halftime show in Los Angeles three years ago, Lamar performed alongside other West Coast and rap/R&B icons: Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem and Mary J. Blige. Anderson .Paak and 50 Cent also made appearances.', 'Lamar will be the first solo rap artist in history to headline the Super Bowl when he takes the stage next Sunday.', "Lamar won't be paid for his Super Bowl halftime show performance, but no artist ever is.", 'The NFL pays for travel expenses for the performer(s) and has a budget for the production as a whole, but the performers themselves do not make money for their halftime shows.', 'Lamar has not announced a Super Bowl halftime show setlist, and he likely does not plan to.', 'However, there are some songs that are likely features in his upcoming performance. "Not Like Us," Lamar\'s biggest song from his rap beef with Drake, is a near-lock to be included in the setlist.', 'Outside of that, songs like "squabble up" and "tv off" from his most recent album, "GNX," are also strong contenders. Among Lamar\'s most frequently performed songs on tour are "HUMBLE." from his fourth studio album, "DAMN." and "Alright" from his third album, "To Pimp a Butterfly." Those are also likely inclusions for his Super Bowl performance in New Orleans.', 'In addition, SZA\'s inclusion as a special guest means that she and Lamar will almost certainly perform one of their seven collaborations. The most likely contenders there are "All the Stars" from the "Black Panther" soundtrack, "luther" or "gloria" from "GNX" or "30 for 30" from SZA\'s latest project, "Lana."', 'SUPER BOWL HALFTIME SHOW:Who will be performing with Kendrick Lamar?', 'Lamar indicates that he is 5-foot-5 in his 2022 song "Savior."', '"I\'ma stand on it, 6\'5" from 5\'5"," he raps.', 'In the context of the song, Lamar is saying he stands on his beliefs rather than "back pedal[ing]" when confronted. This ability to "stand on it," he says, elevates his smaller stature by a full foot.', 'Lamar is 37 years old. He will turn 38 on June 17.', 'Lamar and his partner Whitney Alford, are a very private couple, so their marital status is not currently clear.', 'What is known is that he and Alford were high school sweethearts and have been engaged since 2015, which he confirmed in an interview on "The Breakfast Club" radio show on Power 105.1.', 'Lamar was nominated for seven Grammy Awards this year: five for his hit song "Not Like Us" and two more for "Like That," his song with Future and Metro Boomin. "Not Like Us" won all five awards it was nominated for: Record of the Year, Song of the Year, Best Rap Song, Best Rap Performance and Best Music Video.', 'Prior to this year\'s awards show, Lamar has been nominated for 57 Grammy awards and won 17 of them. At the 2023 edition of the awards show, he was awarded the Grammy for Best Rap Album for "Mr. Morale & the Big Steppers." He also won two more for Best Rap Song and Best Rap Performance for "The Heart Part 5."', '"Not Like Us," Lamar\'s hit song from last May, set the record for most single-day streams for a hip-hop song (12.8 million) and most streams in a week by a rapper (81.2 millions) when it first came out.', "In mid-January, the single hit one billion streams on Spotify, and, as of the time of writing, it's at 1.04 billion streams on the platform.", 'Apple Music doesn\'t share song statistics publicly, but "Not Like Us" was No. 1 on the platform\'s Global list of top songs of 2024.', 'On YouTube, the video containing official audio of the song has been viewed 194 million times, and the music video has been streamed 216 million times. The "Not Like Us" track on YouTube Music, the music streaming service under the Google/Alphabet umbrella, has 658 million plays.', 'Lamar has two kids with Alford. Their daughter, Uzi, was born in July 2019. Details are more sparse about their son, Enoch, but he is likely around two or three years old given his presence as an infant on the cover of Lamar\'s 2022 album "Mr. Morale & the Big Steppers."', "According to various interviews of Lamar from between 2011 and 2020, the earliest roots of Lamar's career as a rapper can be traced back to his time in elementary and middle school.", 'Some of his teachers at the time encouraged him to write more and introduced him to poetry. By high school, he had fully fallen in love with songwriting and rapping, and he was dead-set on making a career out of it, according to a 2020 profile by Marcus J. Moore in "The Nation."', 'In 2004 or 2005, Lamar and DJ/collaborator Dave Free put together a mixtape that he credits with helping him get his first record deal with Top Dawg Entertainment.', 'In 2011, he released his first studio album with Top Dawg, titled "Section.80."', 'SUPER BOWL 59 SINGERS:What to know about halftime show, national anthem', 'Lamar has six studio albums in total, in addition to a self-title EP, five mixtapes, one compilation album and a movie soundtrack (for "Black Panther" [2016]).', 'These are the six studio albums, listed in order of release:', '"K.Dot" was Lamar\'s initial stage name during his earliest years rapping in high school. He dropped the pseudonym in favor of using his first and middle names "because he felt like his initial moniker diverted attention from his actual identity," according to "XXL Magazine."', 'Lamar will still occasionally refer to himself as "K.Dot" (or just "Dot") in some of his recent music.', 'Lamar releases music under his own record label, "pgLang," which he and Free, his longtime collaborator, founded in 2020, and has a direct licensing agreement with Interscope.', "He previously was signed to Top Dawg Entertainment and had a joint agreement with the aforementioned Interscope and Dr. Dre's label, Aftermath.", 'Album sales are a hard metric to track in the age of streaming and "album-equivalent units."', 'According to a Vanity Fair profile of Lamar from June 2018, the rapper had sold over 17.8 million albums at the time. Since then, he\'s released two albums: "Mr. Morale & the Big Steppers" and "GNX."', 'According to music magazine "Hits," "Mr. Morale" had been responsible for 1.06 million album-equivalent units by the end of 2022. "GNX," which came out in late November, reached 319,000 album-equivalent units by the end of its first week and crossed 500,000 in the weeks after.', 'Given that information, Lamar has sold somewhere around 20 million albums/album-equivalent units in his career.', 'In 2018, Lamar was awarded the Pulitzer Prize for Music for his album "DAMN." It was the first piece of music outside of the classical or jazz genres to win the award.', 'On the Pulitzer Prize website the album is described as "a virtuosic song collection unified by its vernacular authenticity and rhythmic dynamism that offers affecting vignettes capturing the complexity of modern African-American life."', 'Lamar is set to begin a North American tour for his new album, "GNX," on April 19 at U.S. Bank Stadium in Minneapolis.', 'Titled the "Grand National Tour," it will feature both Lamar and R&B singer/songwriter SZA, who has been a longtime collaborator with the rapper.', 'The tour will consist of 23 shows, including two at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey, three in Los Angles at SoFi Stadium and two at the Rogers Centre in Toronto. It is scheduled to conclude on June 18 at Northwest Stadium in Landover, Maryland.']

Title: Usher has some advice for Kendrick Lamar ahead of the Super Bowl: ‚ÄòSavor the moment‚Äô
Paragraphs: ['Advertisement', '', '', 'Kendrick Lamar is set to headline the halftime show during Super Bowl LIX this Sunday at Caesars Superdome in New Orleans.', 'If there is anyone Kendrick Lamar should check in with before his Super Bowl halftime performance, Usher may be just the guy.', 'During an appearance on ‚ÄúThe Jennifer Hudson Show‚Äù on Tuesday, Feb. 4, the 46-year-old singer, who treated viewers to an epic halftime show in Las Vegas last year, shared some advice he would give K-Dot ahead of his big performance.', '‚ÄúThe one thing I would say is savor the moment ‚Äòcause you get obsessed in trying to build the best performance but you don‚Äôt realize that it‚Äôs really about enjoying it,‚Äù he said after noting he himself edited his own show roughly 100 times.', '‚ÄúIt might not be perfect, everything may not go exactly the way it‚Äôs supposed to but if you are in your mind and like stuck trying to make something perfect, you‚Äôre not going to look up and smell the flowers,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúAnd realize, ‚ÄòWait a minute, I‚Äôm here and I get a chance to have this moment and I‚Äôm not going to get it again, I‚Äôm not going to get this moment back.‚Äô‚Äù', 'Many may recall that Usher celebrated his Super Bowl halftime performance by tying the knot at a drive-thru chapel with his longtime girlfriend the same night before hitting up a star-studded after-party.', 'Usher explained while he hasn‚Äôt had a chance to catch up with Lamar personally, he has actually chatted with his creative team behind the upcoming show.', '‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt had the chance to catch up with him and tell him, one, how excited I am. Title: Kendrick Lamar to lead hip-hop themed Super Bowl halftime show with Dr Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mary J. Blige and SZA
Paragraphs: ['', '', '', 'ABOUT US', 'ADVERTISE', 'NEW ORLEANS, Feb 4 ‚Äî The Super Bowl halftime show has always been a major part of the annual NFL event, and is America‚Äôs most-watched musical performance of the year.', 'Here is a look at Sunday‚Äôs halftime show during the match between Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs in New Orleans, Louisiana.', 'Who is performing at the Super Bowl Halftime Show 2025?', 'The halftime show will be performed by Kendrick Lamar, who has won 22 Grammy Awards throughout his career, including five this year for his song Not Like Us, which bagged the prestigious Song of the Year and Record of the Year awards on Sunday.', 'Lamar is the first solo rapper to headline the halftime show.', 'The 37-year-old also performed at Super Bowl 2022, alongside Dr Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem and Mary J. Blige. It was the first halftime show to be centred entirely around hip-hop music.', 'Lamar, who started out freestyling and battle rapping at school, released his debut studio album Section.80 in 2011. The album sold 130,000 copies in the U.S. over the next three years.', 'Lamar has released five more studio albums, along with other records, selling over 17.9 million album-equivalent units worldwide. He has achieved five number-one singles in the U.S.', 'Singer-songwriter SZA will join Lamar as a special guest in the performance, which will be directed by Hamish Hamilton, who has directed the halftime show since 2010.', 'Who is sponsoring the Super Bowl Halftime Show?', 'Apple Music, the music, audio and video streaming service of Apple Inc. is the sponsor of this year‚Äôs halftime performance.', 'The company took over sponsorship in 2023, when Rihanna performed, replacing Pepsi who had been sponsor since 2013.', 'Where can I watch the Super Bowl halftime show?', 'The Super Bowl is scheduled to kick off at 6:30pm ET, on Sunday, Feb. 9, with the halftime show expected to begin between 8 p.m. and 8:30 p.m.', 'The event will be broadcast live on FOX, FOX Deportes and streamed on Tubi.', 'A history of the Super Bowl Halftime Show', 'In the beginning, the show mainly featured college marching bands, before progressing to drill teams and performance ensembles, but it all changed in 1991 when boy band New Kids on the Block were the headline act.', 'The rest of the Nineties had artists such as Michael Jackson, Diana Ross, Stevie Wonder and Gloria Estefan perform.', 'At the turn of the century, a number of different acts performed together. In 2000 Phil Collins, Christina Aguilera, Enrique Iglesias and Toni Braxton appeared and the following year brought Aerosmith and NSYNC together.', 'U2 replaced Janet Jackson in 2002, and the band performed a tribute to the victims of the 9/11 attacks. Jackson would get her chance in 2004, where her performance created controversy due to an infamous ‚Äúwardrobe malfunction‚Äù.', 'Justin Timberlake joined Jackson onstage, and at the end of the song Rock Your Body he tore off part of her top, briefly revealing her breast.', 'The incident led to a change for the next few years, with just one artist or group performing, mainly mainstream rock acts such as Paul McCartney, the Rolling Stones, Prince and Bruce Springsteen.', 'In 2011, contemporary artists made a return, with the previous format of a headline act and a number of guests.', 'Since then, Madonna, Beyonce, Bruno Mars, Katy Perry, Lady Gaga, Dr. Dre and Eminem have all performed at the show which guarantees them massive exposure, and a significant increase in album sales and digital downloads. ‚Äî Reuters', '', 'Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information', '', '', '']
